intro: Eriogonum ferrissii, commonly known as the Ferriss's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing bright yellow or white flowers that attract pollinators. Eriogonum ferrissii thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. It is a hardy species that is well adapted to dry conditions and is sometimes used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
